text: This is a list of solar thermal power stations. These include the 354 megawatt (MW) Solar Energy Generating Systems power plant in the US, Solnova solar power station (Spain, 150 MW), Andasol solar power station (Spain, 100 MW), Nevada Solar One (USA, 64 MW), PS20 solar power tower (Spain, 20 MW), and the PS10 solar power tower (Spain, 11 MW). Many other plants are under construction or planned, mainly in Spain and the USA.REN21 (2008). Renewables 2007 Global Status Report (PDF) p. 12. In developing countries, three World Bank projects for integrated solar thermal/combined-cycle gas-turbine power plants in Egypt, Mexico, and Morocco have been approved. ==Operational== Operational Solar Thermal Power Stations Capacity (MW) Name Country Location Notes 354 Solar Energy Generating Systems Mojave Desert California Collection of 9 units 150 Solnova solar power plant Seville Completed 2010 Abengoa Solar Reaches Total of 193 Megawatts Operating 100 Andasol solar power station Granada Completed 2009 Acciona y ACS inscriben sus termosolares en el registro de Industria 64 Nevada Solar One Boulder City, Nevada 50 Ibersol Ciudad Real Puertollano, Ciudad Real Completed May 2009 José María Barreda and Ignacio Galán open IBERDROLA RENOVABLES’ first solar termal power plant 50 Alvarado I Badajoz Completed July 2009 Acciona Status Solarpaces 2008 p.25ACCIONA opens its first CSP plant in Spain, in Extremadura 50 Extresol 1 Torre de Miguel Sesmero (Badajoz) Completed February 2010 50 La Florida Alvarado (Badajoz) completed July 2010 ==Related pages== * List of renewable energy topics * List of large wind farms * Solar power in Spain ==References== * Category:Science-related lists Category:Environment
